snippet: Keys with extra weight could cause the vehicles to switch off in a “jarring event,” and will need modification on several models, the automaker says.
abstract: General Motors says it will recall 3.36 million defective cars worldwide, another low point in safety crisis that has engulfed automaker; once again, problem has to do with keys that could suddenly turn off engines and deactivate air bags.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and DANIELLE IVORY
byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald and Christopher Jensen contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Keys with extra weight could cause the vehicles to switch off in a “jarring event,” and will need modification on several models, the automaker says.

headline.main: In Another Blow, G.M. Recalls 3 Million More Defective Cars
headline.print_headline: In Another Blow, G.M. Recalls 3 Million More Defective Cars
